instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.CHG_CSI_N: What is CHG_CSI_N? This is a typo of CHGR_CSI_N When you see CHG_CSI_N, assume they meant to type CHGR_CSI_N.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
Waterdamage on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, traces to <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> were corroded away, both burned to megaohm resistance.
After replacing ISL and both resistors i got a fan spin as well as a smell of burned <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> resistors. No shorted caps in this circuit, resistance to ground is also OK.
No shorts on charging/InRush MosFets, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> is also OK.
i feel dumb as i do not get why it sucks almost 0.5 Amp in <SIGNAL>CHG_CSI_N</SIGNAL>. <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> was also replaced since it was 40 Ohm instead of 20. Could not find <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> datasheet with a logic diagram, so i have no idea where should i look.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
I hope you didn't put <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> there...

Remove <CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR>/22 and try again.
Be sure to solder <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
well, it was in other repair service and i am not sure what was there before. since i removed the old chip as a first step i am not sure if it was 59 or 58.
What could go wrong if there was a wrong chip on place?  both caps are replaced and repealed, they make no difference even if removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
FUCKING APPLE
can someone tell me which ISL shoud go there? it is 6259 on  the one page and 6258 on another. Unfortunately this is the only one 2936 board in my shop now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message: You need the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. You can pull it from any newer donor board or use a new one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
Comparing schematics for ISL258/59 with your board, should be sufficient to know which one is on your board.
Take a coffee, stay calm and you will gain time...

After <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is soldered, check resistance to ground on pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
i used ISL 6259 all the time, pulled from the known bad CPU board,  also few fresh new chips from mouser.de , so it should not be issue. i  checked CSI/CSO every time i replaced burned resistors/ISL, everything is fine there. 
the thing is it looks like <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> shorts both <SIGNAL>CSI_N</SIGNAL> and P lines to ground at some point, and it happens with some kind of delay, board actually posts and boots from usb stick(of course only one time since both resistors are burning away, so board stays on until power reset),
i guess there no other way to burn current sense rails. 

Boardview pinout actually matches 6258 chip. but i could not find datasheet/pinout for the 6259. can someone post it? 
I will try it tomorrow with 6258, just for lulz. 

on page 3 (power diagram) it is 6259. on page 48 its 6258, all other pages are also 6259.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keeps burning current sense resistors
threads.message:
Don't waste your time with <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>!!!
Your board needs <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>; didn't compare the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> layout (from your board) with schematic?

Did you put correct value for <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/50 (20/10 miliohms)?
Pull off <CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR>/22, not really needed...
